definitions.definition: Religious, ideological , and cultural aspects of the various denominations of the Latter-day Saint movement.
A religion that evolved out of Christianity and was founded by prophet Joseph Smith, whose members believe that the Book of Mormon is scripture and worship God.

main_definition: Religious, ideological , and cultural aspects of the various denominations of the Latter-day Saint movement.
secondary_definitions: A religion that evolved out of Christianity and was founded by prophet Joseph Smith, whose members believe that the Book of Mormon is scripture and worship God.
